subject: Programming
title: The V-Model
description: A fast breakdown of The V-Model for builders.

hook.text: The V-Model added a mirror to waterfall: for every design phase, there's a matching test phase.

buildup.text: Requirements get acceptance tests. Design gets integration tests. Code gets unit tests.

discovery.text: By planning tests early, teams caught misunderstandings before they became expensive defects.

twist.text: The V-Model still assumed sequential flow. You couldn't go back easily when reality changed.

climax.text: Its legacy lives on: the idea that testing should be planned alongside design, not bolted on later.

punchline.text: Plan the test before you write the code.

quiz.question: What does the V-Model add to the waterfall approach?
options: A matching test phase for every design phase
